definition: A title given to a nobleman of high rank, typically denoting a hereditary ruler or a member of the aristocracy. This term is commonly used to refer to individuals who hold a specific position within a hierarchical social structure.

examples.german: Der Graf hat ein großes Schloss.
examples.english: The count has a large castle.
The count is a noble title.

examples.german: Der Graf regiert über sein Land.
examples.english: The count rules over his land.

examples.german: Der Graf ist ein wichtiger politischer Vertreter.
examples.english: The count is an important political representative.
